intro: Sarcogonum platycladum, commonly known as the flat-leaved sarcogonum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
